definitions.definition: Two similar or identical things taken together; often followed by of.
definitions.example: I couldn't decide which of the pair of designer shirts I preferred, so I bought the pair.

definitions.definition: Two people in a relationship, partnership or friendship.
definitions.example: Spouses should make a great pair.

definitions.definition: Used with binary nouns (often in the plural to indicate multiple instances, since such nouns are plural only, except in some technical contexts)
definitions.example: a pair of scissors; two pairs of spectacles; several pairs of jeans

definitions.definition: A couple of working animals attached to work together, as by a yoke.
definitions.example: A pair is harder to drive than two mounts with separate riders.

definitions.definition: A poker hand that contains two cards of identical rank, which cannot also count as a better hand.
A score of zero runs (a duck) in both innings of a two-innings match.
A double play, two outs recorded in one play.
definitions.example: They turned a pair to end the fifth.

definitions.definition: A doubleheader, two games played on the same day between the same teams
definitions.example: The Pirates took a pair from the Phillies.

definitions.definition: A boat for two sweep rowers.
A pair of breasts
The exclusion of one member of a parliamentary party from a vote, if a member of the other party is absent for important personal reasons.
Two members of opposite parties or opinion, as in a parliamentary body, who mutually agree not to vote on a given question, or on issues of a party nature during a specified time.
definitions.example: There were two pairs on the final vote.

definitions.definition: A number of things resembling one another, or belonging together; a set.

(kinematics) In a mechanism, two elements, or bodies, which are so applied to each other as to mutually constrain relative motion; named in accordance with the motion it permits, as in turning pair, sliding pair, twisting pair.
An exciting or extraordinary scene, exhibition, performance etc.
definitions.example: The horse race was a thrilling spectacle.

definitions.definition: An embarrassing or unedifying scene or situation.
definitions.example: He made a spectacle out of himself.

definitions.definition: (usually in the plural) An optical instrument consisting of two lenses set in a light frame, and worn to assist sight, to obviate some defect in the organs of vision, or to shield the eyes from bright light.
An aid to the intellectual sight.
A spyglass; a looking-glass.
The brille of a snake.
A frame with different coloured lenses on a semaphore signal through which light from a lamp shines at night, often a part of the signal arm.
A pair of lenses set in a frame worn on the nose and ears in order to correct deficiencies in eyesight or to ornament the face.
